bug.author: felixnext
bug.summary: Reload after file change breaks on Windows
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
Auto reloading under windows breaks, apparently due to a file-path problem. The streamlit just goes blank (only headline shown). Error Message: Cannot change script from C:\data\example.py to .example.py
Apparent cause seems to be a file handling problem under windows.
<denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
Create a new streamlit *.py file somewhere (e.g. C:/data/example.py) Run streamlit (streamlit run example.py) Open Browser and load page Edit the file and select always rerun Browser window goes completely blank except the header bar
<denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: 0.45.0 Python version: 3.5 OS version: Windows 10 Browser version: Brave 0.68.138

comments.comment: This is fixed on version 0.47, please upgrade your streamlit version using : pip install streamlit --upgrade
